column4: It  is  observed that in  the  summing up  the  learned trial judge erred when he

column3: charged the jury on questions  of fact to  be  decided by the jury. The law as  regards
to  evaluation  of  circumstantial  evidence,  and
evidence  led  in  this  case  and  also  the  burden  of proof and  the  presumption  of
innocence, has not been explained to the jury.

column4: It  is  to  be  noted  that  in  such  glaring  circumstances  of non-direction  and

column3: mis-direction arising out of the  summing up  of the jury, the  Senior State  Counsel
appearing  for  the  Respondent  vehemently  defended  the  conviction  and  sentence
and did not concede to any of the said infirmities discussed above.

column4: In  all  the  above  circumstances, we find  that the misdirection of the jury by
judge  has  caused  a  substantial  miscarriage  of justice  which

column3: warrants an acquittal of the Appellant.
